item.description:
Join new playable Gearloc characters Stanza and Duster as they journey down the Sibron River in search of answers in this standalone expansion/sequel to Too Many Bones!

Too Many Bones: Undertow allows for 1-2 players out of the box, but by bringing in additional Gearlocs from the original game or adding in characters like Ghillie, Nugget, and Tink, you can create an adventure for up to four players. Undertow features all new baddies, encounters, tyrants, and a double-sided battle mat. Battles take place both on land and on your raft, adding even more variety and brain-bending tactics.

comment.value: The more I play this one, the more I like it. The dice + tactics during battles reminds me in some ways of what I like about KD:M showdowns. The timer mechanism develops tension and the decision making during character customization keeps things interesting. Replay value is high since characters are so different and character development is variable.
So excited for this.
Nice addition to my TMB Collection. Love Duster.
Juni 2018
Backed on Kickstarter. Estimated delivery June 2018; actual delivery September 2018.
Proud KS Backer
TMB Undertow Bundle (inkl. Gasket und Adventure Map 2.0)
About the best solo experience around!
Awaiting kickstarter...

Stand alone expansion that allows inclusion of previous characters and gives additional campaign elements to an already fantastic game. Top quality build and design. Love this and perfect for sad and lonely solo gaming.
1-2 60-180 minutes Best with 2

It's everything that I like about the original Too Many Bones with a handful of tweaks and upgrades, plus a more affordable price. I particularly like the water combat, which adds unique battles to the game.
With Gasket Character Expansion
soloed. some nice new content. not enough on its own for repeated plays, but with the other expansion stuff it will keep me busy for a long while.
KS Edition

2018-06. Kickstarter.
Loved the original game. Components, gameplay, all of it come together nicely to form a strategic roleplaying like battle game.
KS backed. Review copy also.

Kickstarted: Due June 2018 (possibly September or October)
Can't wait for this!! Going to be a great addition to the TMB universe!
Arrived yesterday. A late pledge from KS. Just did my own private unboxing. Looks great. How does it play? Looks a bit complicated. So I am happy there are quite some videos available.

Very much looking forward to this expansion! The game features a water themed environment along with mechs and ancient technology. Backward compatible with the original game. The storytelling along with the game dynamics and high quality components are amazing! High replayability as well due to the various encounter cards, bosses, and different ways to power up your character via skill trees. Highly recommend, especially to people who have enjoyed RPGs, such as Skyrim, Final Fantasy, WOW, etc.
First game from them, played as Duster and immediately wanted to play again. Help year old helps me play and wanted to play three nights in row. Not much keeps him entertained.
superb game!
1-2 Players, Best 3+
Looking forward to this! Get involved on the Kickstarter

KS 2017. Would highly encourage anyone to get in while they can. This may not be inexpensive compared to other games, but all of the components are of the highest quality, the story components and art are exciting, but still light enough to be engaging for many audiences. I regret not buying the full weight health chips when I bought the base game, they are incredibly fun to play with. Hope everyone else is as excited as I am!
Pledged for the expansion character, may eventually expand to getting the whole thing.
Rating based off current TMB game... if it is anything like it.. then yea 10 for me! The greatness outweighs any flaws that I might have had!

I'm not sure how they did it but they found ways to improve upon what was already an incredible game. This game adds new characters, a double-sided play mat, new baddie types that enter the sides of the map to surround you, obstacle pieces, and even more witty and clever encounter cards.
Have not played yet.
Kickstarter received 5.10.2018

The original TMB is packed full of top notch components and fantastic characters. Chip Theory Games (CTG) truely produces the most amazing games and products and has a long standing reputation for wonderful on the spot customer service. I know I will continue backing CTG on future products for years to come. Glad to be part of the Undertow KS Campaign, including participating in the decision making for the mini story. Best part, is those decisions made in the daily spot light updates impact both the planned components for Undertow, as well as impacting "mini-stretch goals" that are not listed along with the listed stretch goals.
Great work CTG! Thanks for inviting us in for the ride and for this new twist on SG's and backer participation in the evolution of the components in the game!
KS Edition
[b]Accessories:[/b] (see Too Many Bones Accessories) and adventure map 2.0, waterlogged book

After a few plays I would say I prefer original TMB over this. Undertow has many small, side rules that interact awkwardly with each other and slow the game down. Still, TMB:U is an impressive game overall.

1-2 Jugadores
Si Solitario

More of the same incredible game from the guys at Chip Theory. New life has been breathed into TMB for me, which was my game of 2017. I absolutely love the asymmetry, the components, the artwork, the gameplay, everything is a 10 for me other than the length, which can be troublesome. I don't mind a long game, I just need it to be a bit shorter to see the table more often. Everything else about this game is off-the-charts amazing.
Not going to rate but cannot wait for all this new content. Absolutely love this game. Goes down extremely well with both my gaming group and family. No one ever turns down a game of Too Many Bones.
TMB is an good play, with replayablity, I am not much on co-op games, but this one is hard to win, but fun to play. You loose a lot, but want to play again because you just know you can win.
Love too many bones, I have backed Undertow on Kickstarter. Due summer 2018
Preordered July 2018
